articles.author: Jeff Mason
articles.description: Trump also said he will announce reciprocal tariffs on Tuesday or Wednesday, to take effect almost immediately.
articles.title: Trump to announce 25% steel and aluminum tariffs in latest trade escalation

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Overnight Russian drone attacks sparked a fire in Kyiv and injured a woman and damaged several houses in the northeastern city of Sumy, Ukrainian officials said on Monday.
articles.title: Russia launches drone attacks on Kyiv, Sumy, Ukrainian officials say

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Marriages in China dropped by a fifth last year despite manifold efforts by authorities to encourage young couples to wed and have children to boost the country's declining population.
articles.title: Chinese marriages slid by a fifth in 2024, further fanning birthrate concerns

articles.author: Sarita Singh, Shivangi Acharya, Shivam Patel
articles.description: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi is preparing additional tariff cuts ahead of his meeting with U.S. President Donald Trump that could boost American exports to India and avoid a potential trade war, government officials said.
articles.title: India's Modi to meet Trump with planned tariff concessions

articles.author: Fatos Bytyci
articles.description: Kosovo's ruling Vetevendosje party is on track to come first in Sunday's parliamentary election, but it fell short of an outright majority needed to rule without coalition partners, preliminary results showed on Monday.
articles.title: Kosovo's ruling party set to win election but lose majority

articles.author: Alexandra Valencia, Yury Garcia
articles.description: Noboa says his deployment of the military on the streets and within prisons has reduced violent deaths by 15%, led to a drastic fall in prison violence, and helped in the capture of major gang leaders.
articles.title: Run-off likely in Ecuador presidential race as leftist gains

articles.author: Kate Abnett
articles.description: Many of the world's biggest polluter nations have missed a U.N. deadline to set new climate targets as efforts to curb global warming come under pressure following U.S. President Donald Trump's election.
articles.title: Most countries miss UN deadline for new climate targets

articles.author: Hyunsu Yim
articles.description: South Korea's spy agency has accused Chinese AI app DeepSeek of "excessively" collecting personal data and using all input data to train itself, and questioned the app's responses to questions relating to issues of national pride.
articles.title: South Korea spy agency says DeepSeek 'excessively' collects personal data

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Japanese Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba's cabinet approval rate rose 5 points from the previous month to 44% in a February 7-9 poll, recovering to the highest level since his October inauguration, public broadcaster NHK reported on Monday.
articles.title: Japan PM Ishiba's approval rate rises 5 points to 44%, NHK poll shows

articles.author: Lucy Craymer
articles.description: Concerns are mounting in New Zealand as the Cook Islands’ Prime Minister travels to China this week to sign agreements without properly consulting with New Zealand, despite the two nations' constitutional ties.
articles.title: New Zealand concerns mount as Cook Islands PM plans to sign agreement with China
